snippet: At the heart of the issue is a debate within the Obama administration on whether it was time to officially designate Boko Haram as a “foreign terrorist organization.”
abstract: Abduction of more than 200 schoolgirls in Nigeria has led to new scrutiny of United States' counterterrorism strategy toward Boko Haram during Hillary Clinton's tenure as secretary of state; at heart of issue is debate within Obama administration on whether it is time to officially designate group as 'foreign terrorist organization.'
lead_paragraph: At the heart of the issue is a debate within the Obama administration on whether it was time to officially designate Boko Haram as a “foreign terrorist organization.”

headline.main: Schoolgirl Abductions Put Scrutiny on U.S. Terrorism Strategy
headline.print_headline: Schoolgirl Abductions Put Scrutiny on U.S. Terrorism Strategy
